intro: Bidens tenuisecta, commonly known as slenderleaf beggar ticks, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow, with a distinctive appearance that resembles tiny, clustered stars. Bidens tenuisecta is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadside ditches and wetlands.
